title: 'Any tragedy, like the earthquake that has just plunged Morocco into mourning, shatters our certainties'
description: Rachid Benzine, in an article for 'Le Monde' says that 'the humanitarian catastrophe affecting the kingdom brings us face to face with something immeasurable that escapes all comprehension.'

title: Tens of thousands march to kick off climate summit
description: Ahead of UN meetings this week, thousands took to the streets to demand that President Biden and other world leaders stop new oil and gas drilling.

title: Rugby World Cup: England wears down in Japan 34-12 victory
description: The Red Roses shifted momentum late in the match to pull off a second consecutive victory.

title: Rugby World Cup: Fiji beats Australia for the first time in 69 years
description: The Fijians had to win to stay in the hunt for their first quarterfinal in 16 years and lived to fight on while putting the heat back on Wales and Australia, who meet next Sunday.

title: Saliva: Gliding between desire and disgust
description: This summer, columnist Maïa Mazaurette embarked on an adventure like no other as she steered her vessel through the currents of sexuality's diverse fluids.

title: UK comedian Russell Brand accused of sexual assault
description: According to The Sunday Times, the Times and Channel 4, one woman alleged Brand raped her in his Los Angeles home while another claims he assaulted her during a three-month relationship while she was 16. Brand denied the accusations.

title: Covid-19: Why France is bringing its fall vaccination campaign forward
description: Authorities are concerned about the resurgence of the virus and the appearance of new sub-variants. Vulnerable people, a population of 12-18 million, are encouraged to get vaccinated from October 2.

title: David Grann, the master of literary investigation who's busy seducing Hollywood
description: The film world is snapping up the American writer's works. After 'Killers of the Flower Moon,' to be released this autumn, Martin Scorsese is planning to bring 'The Wager: A Tale of Shipwreck, Mutiny and Murder' to the big screen.

title: Four months of self-sufficiency in a forest: A French couple's poetic and environmental project
description: Between May and September, Blandine Rouche and Robin Amaz lived self-sufficiently in a forest. They used low-tech solutions, foraged, grew spirulina and bred crickets.

title: Rugby World Cup: South Africa thrashes Romania 76-0
description: South Africa’s scrum-half Cobus Reinach and winger Makazole Mapimpi each scored a hat-trick of tries as their side cruised to an astonishing win over Romania in Pool B.

title: Le Pen flaunts political closeness with Salvini on Italy visit
description: Ahead of the June European elections, the leader of the Rassemblement National took part on Sunday in an annual party thrown by the head of the Northern League near Bergamo.

title: The long history of Derna, Libya's martyred city
description: Devastated by catastrophic flooding, Libya's port city of Derna has a long history of rebellion, dating back to Ancient times up to the first intervention of US Marines in 1805.

title: Macron pampers French Catholics ahead of Pope visit to Marseille
description: The French president announced the launch of a fund-raising campaign to renovate thousands of endangered religious buildings across the country and defended his intention to attend Pope Francis' mass in Marseille on September 23.

title: North Korea's Kim Jong Un wraps up Russia trip
description: The six-day trip triggered global concerns about weapons transfer deals between the two countries locked in separate standoffs with the West.

title: Italy's PM calls for EU help after Lampedusa Island migrant surge
description: French government sources said late Saturday that Italian Prime Minister Georgia Meloni and French President Emmanuel Macron had agreed on the need to reinforce European cooperation on the issue.

title: Three vegan pie recipes for summer
description: For dishes that are easy to prepare and healthy, here's a selection of scrumptious tarts, with cherry tomatoes, zucchini or onion compote.

title: Rugby World Cup: Victory over Tonga cements Ireland's status as competition favorite
description: Ireland easily topped Tonga (59-16) on Saturday, sending a clear message to France, New Zealand, and South Africa.

title: Ligue 1: Benjamin Mendy's and Wissam Ben Yedder's controversial paths cross in Lorient
description: The Ligue 1 match between Lorient and Monaco on Sunday will be marked by the return of Benjamin Mendy, recently acquitted of sex offenses in the UK, and the presence on the other team of Wissam Ben Yedder, who is accused of rape.

title: Fashion film: Welcome to Gordon von Steiner's dreamy country party
description: Setting the scene for the winter, director and photographer Gordon von Steiner and stylist Imruh Asha have staged a fairy tale in which young people invent a fun, glamorous and festive summer getaway.

title: A family's grief after losing son to gang violence
description: The number of gang murders in France has increased in recent years, with the victims becoming increasingly younger. Le Monde spoke to the Ben Khelifa family, who recently lost a child.

title: Brazil: Plane crash in the Amazon kills 14 people
description: The Embraer PT-SOG aircraft had taken off from Manaus, the Amazonas state capital and the biggest city in the Amazon, and was attempting to land in heavy rain when it crashed.

title: Joe Biden voices his support for automotive strikers
description: The historic United Auto Workers union is demanding a 36% pay rise over four years, a 32-hour week and a return to guaranteed pensions from the management of General Motors, Ford and Stellantis.

title: After the coup in Gabon, the transition of power is in search of balance
description: Brice Oligui Nguema, the country's new strongman, has reached out to the opposition and those close to deposed president Ali Bongo Ondimba while granting himself vast powers in the transitional government.

title: Iran withdraws accreditation of several UN nuclear agency inspectors
description: The director of the International Atomic Energy Agency denounced the move as 'disproportionate and unprecedented.'
